Constructor.

Manages receiving the ansiL2Pkt packet, parsing according to the ANSI layer 2 protocol and returning the ANSI layer 7 packet.
The complete ANSI layer 7 packet received from the device.
Thrown when a communication timeout occurs with a device.
Thrown when the maximum number of naks have been received.
Thrown when a port failure occurs.
byte[] txPacket = new byte[3]{0x30, 0x00, 0x05}; byte[] rxPacket = null; m_ANSIL2.Send(txPacket); m_ANSIL2.Receive(out rxPacket);
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created 07/06/06 mrj 7.30.00 Fixed timing issues 08/03/06 rcg 7.35.00 Fixed several issues related to using .NET 2.0 SerialPort object 09/26/14 AF 4.00.62 523633 Fixed a corner case where the timer expired but we received the whole packet. In that case we can ignore the timeout 08/30/16 jrf 4.70.15 No WR Quieting compiler warning and disposing of tmrRxDataRcvd in a finally block.

Maximum packet size that the datalink (layer 2) can support. Typically determined by using layer 7 negotiate service.
Thrown when the maximum packet size being assigned is not supported.
m_ANSIL2.MaxPacketSize = 128;

CANSIL7 supports the ANSI application layer 7 communication with a device.
CANSIL7 is internal abstract which implies it is not visible outside the assembly and must be inherited.
internal class C1218L7 : CANSIL7
Revision History MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created

Constructor.
A CANSIL2 object for which CANSIL7 can use to send and receive packets.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created

Performs the identification service.
A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.
PSEMResponse Result = m_ANSIL7.Identify();
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created

Performs the negotiate service.
Maximum packet size supported, in bytes. This value shall not be greater than 8192 bytes. Maximum number of packets this layer is able to reassemble into an upper layer data structure at one time. The baud rate to negotiate to.
A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.
PSEMResponse Result = m_ANSIL7.Identify(); if (PSEMResponse.OK == Result) { Result = m_ANSIL7.Negotiate(); }
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created 08/17/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Adding real negotiate support 06/17/10 AF 2.41.11 Added baud rate 38400 (used only by the M2 Gateway)

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CANSIL7.TimingSetup(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Changes the timing parameters. Calling this service will cause our C12.18 meters to switch to C12.21.
member.param: Channel Traffic Timeout in seconds
Inter-character Timeout in seconds
Response Timeout in seconds
Number of retries. If the default of 3 doesn't work, 45 probably won't work either.
member.returns: A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.

CANSIL2 is internal which implies it is not visible outside the assembly.

members.member:
Performs a logon to the device. It sends Identify, negotiate, and then logon.
The logon user name.
The logon user ID.
A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.
Thrown when the user length exceeds the acceptable length.
Communication comm = new Communication(); comm.OpenPort("COM4:"); CPSEM PSEM = new CPSEM(comm); PSEM.Logon("username"); PSEM.Security("userpassword");
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 08/01/05 bdm 7.13.00 N/A Created 08/16/06 KRC 7.35.00 N/A Need real Logon support 08/31/06 mrj 7.35.00 Save off the user id

Performs the Negotiate service. Maximum packet size supported, in bytes. This alue shall not be greater than 8192 bytes. Maximum number of packets this layer is able to reassemble into an upper layer data structure at one time. The baud rate to negotiate to.
A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.
Communication comm = new Communication(); comm.OpenPort("COM4:"); CPSEM PSEM = new CPSEM(comm); PSEM.Identify(); PSEM.Negotiate(128, 254, 9600 );
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 04/12/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 08/31/06 mrj 7.35.00 Save off negotiated packet info

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.TimingSetup(System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte,System.Byte)
member.summary: Changes the timing parameters. Calling this service will cause our C12.18 meters to switch to C12.21.
member.param: Channel Traffic Timeout in seconds
Inter-character Timeout in seconds
Response Timeout in seconds
Number of retries. If the default of 3 doesn't work, 45 probably won't work either.
member.returns: A PSEMResponse encapsulating the layer 7 response to the layer 7 request.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.MaxWaitTime
member.summary: The max time the protocol allows between packets is 255 seconds. Use this constant with the Wait() request to keep the device from timing out.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.IdentityByte
member.summary: Supports retrieving and setting the identity byte (reserved byte).

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.NextPacketToggleSet
member.summary: Returns whether or not the next PSEM packet has the toggle bit set.

member.name: P:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.CTO
member.summary: Supports retrieving and setting the CTO (Channel Traffic Timeout).

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.MaintainCommunicationsSession
member.summary:
This method is used to maintain continuous communications with a metering device by periodically issuing wait commands. The time between wait commands is determined by the protocol's default timeout values and will be reset each commands are issued to the meter.
Note that this method is a private method and all exception handling is the responsibility of the calling routine
member.remarks:
Note that Windows.Forms Timers are used instead of system timers. Windows.Form timers are intended for single threaded, UI oriented applications while system timers are intended for thread safe applications. Since serial communications is inherently single threaded and this protocol class is not intended for concurrent use, Windows.Forms.Timers are the better choice
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 11/20/06 mah 8.00.00 N/A Created 03/23/07 mrj 8.00.21 Do not allow multiple session timers to get created.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.DisableSessionMaintenance
member.summary: This method is to be called when logging off a meter. It disables periodic calls to the meter and releases the timer coordinating the calls

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.KeepSessionAliveHandler(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary:
This method is called when the maintenance timer is fired. It is responsible
for issueing a command to the meter to keep it alive and/or cleaning up if we are no longer on line with the meter

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.ResetSessionTimer
member.summary: This method should be called after each successful communication with the meter. It resets the maintenance timer for the communication session and prevents unnecessary wakeup commands from being issued and slowing the application down unnecessarily

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.ResetSessionTimerToMax
member.summary: This method is called after a wait is successfully sent to the meter. It resets the maintenance timer for the communication session to 245 seconds.

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.PSEM.CPSEM.PauseSessionTimer
member.summary: This method should be called immediately before communicating with the meter. It stops the maintenance timer from firing and prevents the application from queuing up a wait command during the execution of another meter operation

members.member:
This property gets or sets the maximum download packet size.
An int representing the maximum packet size.
This value can not be set lower than the minimum packet size.
Communication Comm = new Communication(); Comm.OpenPort("COM4:"); SCSProtocol scsProtocol = new SCSProtocol(Comm); scsProtocol.MaxPacketSize = 64;
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 04/12/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 05/10/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Modified 06/16/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Removed tertiary operator 02/07/07 mrj 8.00.11 Changed to allow any packet size to be set.

Has this device been identified? If so, you can use the protocol's saved device identity values to avoid reissuing Wakeup and Identify requests. Note that if you switch devices (daisy chaining, etc.), you still need to re-identify the new device.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 09/08/06 mcm 7.35.00 N/A Created

Returns the device ID retreived during the last Identify request. If Identify has not been called, you shouldn't be asking, but I'll return an empty string.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 09/08/06 mcm 7.35.00 N/A Created

Returns the device Type retreived during the last Identify request. If Identify has not been called, you shouldn't be asking, but I'll return an empty string.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 09/08/06 mcm 7.35.00 N/A Created

Returns the Meter Start Address retreived during the last Identify request. If Identify has not been called, you shouldn't be asking, but I'll return an empty string.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 09/08/06 mcm 7.35.00 N/A Created

Returns the Meter Stop Address retreived during the last Identify request. If Identify has not been called, you shouldn't be asking, but I'll return an empty string.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 09/08/06 mcm 7.35.00 N/A Created

This method performs actions to get the attention of a SCS device. In the SCS protocol this is performed by sending multiple ENQs to the device until the device acknowledges it with an ACK message. When an ACK message is received we must pause for 1 second before returning processing to the calling routine.
A SCSProtocolResponse representing the protocol response.
Communication Comm = new Communication(); Comm.OpenPort("COM4:"); SCSProtocol scsProtocol = new SCSProtocol(Comm); scsProtocol.WakeUpDevice(25);
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 04/12/06 mrj 7.30.00 N/A Created 05/04/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Rewrote 06/16/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Changed to Send Enquires one after another with no pause 09/28/06 mrj 7.35.00 Adjusted for better performance on handheld.

Uploads data from the device starting at a given address.
The base page address to start the upload The data length of the upload The data buffer to read the bytes into A SCSProtocolResponse representing the protocol response.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/19/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Created

Downloads data to the device starting at a given address.
The base page address to start the download The length of bytes to download The buffer of data to download A SCSProtocolResponse representing the protocol response.
MM/DD/YY who Version Issue# Description -------- --- ------- ------ --------------------------------------- 06/19/06 jrf 7.30.00 N/A Created

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.MaintainCommunicationsSession
member.summary:
This method is used to maintain continuous communications with a metering device by periodically issuing wake up commands. The time between wait commands is determined by the protocol's default timeout values and will be reset whenever commands are issued to the meter.
Note that this method is a private method and all exception handling is the responsibility of the calling routine
member.remarks: Note that Windows.Forms Timers are used instead of system timers. Windows.Form timers are intended for single threaded, UI oriented applications while system timers are intended for thread safe applications. Since serial communications is inherently single threaded and this protocol class is not intended for concurrent use, Windows.Forms.Timers are the better choice

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.DisableSessionMaintenance
member.summary: This method is to be called when logging off a meter. It disables periodic calls to the meter and releases the timer coordinating the calls

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.KeepSessionAliveHandler(System.Object,System.EventArgs)
member.summary: This method is called when the maintenance timer is fired. It is responsible for issueing a command to the meter to keep it alive and/or cleaning up if we are no longer on line with the meter

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.ResetSessionTimer
member.summary: This method should be called after each successful communication with the meter. It resets the maintenance timer for the communication session and prevents unnecessary wakeup commands from being issued and slowing the application down unnecessarily

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.PauseSessionTimer
member.summary: This method should be called immediately before communicating with the meter. It stops the maintenance timer from firing and prevents the application from queuing up a wakeup command during the execution of another meter operation

member.name: M:Itron.Metering.Communications.SCS.SCSProtocol.KeepAlive
member.summary: Sends ENQ's to keep the meter's session alive (up to 3 ENQ's looking for and ACK).
member.exception: Timeout thrown if ACK is not received from ENQ.

members.member: Serial port communications object

Destructor.
The communication class event thread blocks until the port handle is closed. A destructor is implemented to make sure that clean up is performed as soon as possible.
